intro: Pleurogyne thomsonii, commonly known as Thomson's pleurogyne, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
